Package cetus.analysis

Class Reduction

  • java.lang.Object
    • cetus.analysis.AnalysisPass
      • cetus.analysis.Reduction
  • public class Reduction
extends AnalysisPass
    Performs reduction variable analysis to detect and annotate statements like x = x + i in loops. An Annotation is added right before loops that contain reduction variables.

      • analyzeStatement

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Set<Expression>> analyzeStatement​(Statement istmt)

      • analyzeStatement2

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Set<Expression>> analyzeStatement2​(Statement istmt)
        Reduction recognition on OpenMP critical sections including ForLoop, CompoundStatement, and a Statement. This method is the same as analyzeStatement() except that this method skips self-carried-output dependency checking part; analyzeStatement() works on outer-most loops, but this method works on inner-loops (loops contained in a critical section of a parallel region can be considered as inner-loops with respect to the enclosing parallel region).
        Parameters:
        istmt - critical sections
        Returns:
        mapping of (reduction operator, reduction variables)

      • print_reduction

        public void print_reduction​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Set<Expression>> map)

      • displaySet

        public void displaySet​(java.lang.String name,
                       java.util.Set iset)
